October 10, 2004: Fiction
THE DARK TOWER, by Stephen King. (Donald M. Grant/Scribner, $35.) Volume 7
of "The Dark Tower," a series about time travel and a heroic quest.
TRACE, by Patricia Cornwell. (Putnam, $26.95.) The inept man who replaced Dr.
Kay Scarpetta as chief medical examiner of Virginia asks for her help in
investigating the unexplained death of a 14-year-old girl.
THE DA VINCI CODE, by Dan Brown. (Doubleday, $24.95.) The murder of a
curator at the Louvre leads to a trail of clues found in the work of Leonardo and to
the discovery of a centuries-old secret society.
NIGHTS OF RAIN AND STARS, by Maeve Binchy. (Dutton, $25.95.) Life on a
small Greek island is changed forever after tragedy strikes.
JONATHAN STRANGE & MR. NORRELL, by Susanna Clarke. (Bloomsbury,
$27.95.) A literary fantasy involving a Yorkshire magician and the Napoleonic
Wars.
ARE YOU AFRAID OF THE DARK? by Sidney Sheldon. (Morrow, $25.95.) Two
women are caught in a web of mysterious deaths and disappearances that are
linked to the world's largest think tank.
THE FIVE PEOPLE YOU MEET IN HEAVEN, by Mitch Albom. (Hyperion, $19.95.)
An old man who died while trying to rescue a little girl from danger discovers that
all will be explained to him in the afterlife.
ANGELS & DEMONS, by Dan Brown. (Atria, $17.95.) A Harvard scholar tries to
save the Vatican from the machinations of an underground society.
THE SYSTEM OF THE WORLD, by Neal Stephenson. (Morrow, $27.95.) Volume
3 of "The Baroque Cycle," a tale of late-17th-century and early-18th-century
history, science and philosophy, featuring Jack Shaftoe.
THE RULE OF FOUR, by Ian Caldwell and Dustin Thomason. (Dial, $24.) Two
Princeton students who are trying to unravel the mysteries of a Renaissance text
become ensnared in murderous intrigue.
BLIND ALLEY, by Iris Johansen. (Bantam, $25.) Eve Duncan, "probably the best
forensic sculptor in the world," battles a serial killer.
LITTLE EARTHQUAKES, by Jennifer Weiner. (Atria, $26.) Love, marriage and,
especially, motherhood as seen through the lives of women in Philadelphia.
THE PLOT AGAINST AMERICA, by Philip Roth. (Houghton Mifflin, $26.) The
experiences of a Jewish family in Newark after Charles A. Lindbergh defeats
Franklin D. Roosevelt in the 1940 presidential election.
October 10, 2004
Non-Fiction
AMERICA (THE BOOK), by Jon Stewart, Ben Karlin and David Javerbaum.
(Warner, $24.95.) "The Daily Show" offers a lavishly illustrated parody of a civics
textbook.
THE FAMILY, by Kitty Kelley. (Doubleday, $29.95.) The author of biographies of
Frank Sinatra and Nancy Reagan tells "the real story of the Bush dynasty."
UNFIT FOR COMMAND, by John E. O'Neill and Jerome R. Corsi. (Regnery,
$27.95.) A negative appraisal of John Kerry's conduct in Vietnam.
BETWEEN A ROCK AND A HARD PLACE, by Aron Ralston. (Atria, $26.) A
mountaineer describes a nightmarish experience in Utah and the extreme
measure he took in order to save his life.
AMERICAN SOLDIER, by Tommy Franks with Malcolm McConnell.
(ReganBooks/HarperCollins, $27.95.) A memoir by the former head of the United
States Central Command.
IN THE SHADOW OF NO TOWERS, by Art Spiegelman. (Pantheon, $19.95.) A
graphic memoir about the attack on the World Trade Center.
EATS, SHOOTS & LEAVES, by Lynne Truss. (Gotham, $17.50.) An
Englishwoman expounds on the use and misuse of punctuation marks.
CHAIN OF COMMAND, by Seymour M. Hersh. (HarperCollins, $25.95.) From
9/11 to Abu Ghraib: the investigative reporter tracks President Bush's war on
terror.
CONFESSIONS OF AN HEIRESS, by Paris Hilton with Merle Ginsberg.
(Fireside/Simon & Schuster, $22.) The celebrity jet-setter and star of "The Simple
Life" tells what it's like to be young, rich and beautiful.
MY LIFE, by Bill Clinton. (Knopf, $35.) From Hope, Ark., to the White House: the
autobiography of the 42nd president.
DEMOCRACY MATTERS, by Cornel West. (Penguin Press, $24.95.) The author
of "Race Matters" looks at "the rise of an ugly imperialism" in the wake of 9/11.
BUSHWORLD, by Maureen Dowd. (Putnam, $25.95.) A journalist's assessment of
President Bush, based on her columns and articles in The New York Times.
HOW TO MAKE LOVE LIKE A PORN STAR, by Jenna Jameson with Neil
Strauss. (ReganBooks/HarperCollins, $27.95.) A leading lady of adult movies
describes her unusual life and work.
PATRIOT REIGN, by Michael Holley. (Morrow, $23.95.) Behind the scenes with
Bill Belichick and his New England Patriot coaching staff.
